title: Spicy Silken Tofu Stew
ingredients: - 3 cups chopped (about ½ inch) mixed fresh mushrooms
- 4 cups Mushroom Stock, homemade or store-bought
- ½ cup brine from the jar of pepperoncini
- 2 tablespoons minced fresh Thai bird chilies (about 8) or serrano chilies (about 4)
- 12 ounces sundubu or soft silken tofu, drained if necessary
- Charred Red Chili Paste, optional, for serving
directions: 1. Stir together all the finishing oil ingredients and set aside.
2. Place scallions on a work surface and smash the whites with the flat of a knife. Thinly slice them.
3. In a stone pot or medium heavy pot, combine olive oil, garlic, and ginger. Set over medium-high heat and cook, stirring, until fragrant but not colored, 30 seconds to 1 minute.
4. Add the scallions, mushrooms, onion, stock, pepperoncini, brine, chilies, salt, and soy sauce. Raise heat and bring to a boil, skimming any froth.
5. Squeeze in the sundubu (or spoon in the silken tofu in four large chunks). Reduce heat and simmer gently without stirring until onions are tender and tofu is heated through, about 5 minutes.
6. Stir in the finishing oil and serve with optional chili paste.
